title: Greater Copenhagen (Folketing constituency)
text:
Greater Copenhagen () is one of the 12 <a href="multi-member">multi-member</a> <a href="Constituencies%20of%20Denmark">constituencies</a> of the <a href="Folketing">Folketing</a>, the national <a href="legislature">legislature</a> of <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>. The constituency was established in 2007 following the public administration structural reform. It consists of the <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Denmark">municipalities</a> of <a href="Albertslund%20Municipality">Albertslund</a>, <a href="Ballerup%20Municipality">Ballerup</a>, <a href="Br%C3%B8ndby%20Municipality">Brøndby</a>, <a href="Gentofte%20Municipality">Gentofte</a>, <a href="Gladsaxe%20Municipality">Gladsaxe</a>, <a href="Glostrup%20Municipality">Glostrup</a>, <a href="Herlev%20Municipality">Herlev</a>, <a href="H%C3%B8je-Taastrup%20Municipality">Høje-Taastrup</a>, <a href="Hvidovre%20Municipality">Hvidovre</a>, <a href="Ish%C3%B8j%20Municipality">Ishøj</a>, <a href="Lyngby-Taarb%C3%A6k%20Municipality">Lyngby-Taarbæk</a>, <a href="R%C3%B8dovre%20Municipality">Rødovre</a> and <a href="Vallensb%C3%A6k%20Municipality">Vallensbæk</a>. The constituency currently elects 11 of the 179 members of the Folketing using the <a href="Open%20list">open</a> <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a> <a href="electoral%20system">electoral system</a>. At the <a href="2019%20Danish%20general%20election">2019 general election</a> it had 370,371 registered electors.
Electoral system.
Greater Copenhagen currently elects 11 of the 179 members of the Folketing using the <a href="Open%20list">open</a> <a href="party-list%20proportional%20representation">party-list proportional representation</a> <a href="electoral%20system">electoral system</a>. Constituency seats are allocated using the <a href="D%27Hondt%20method">D'Hondt method</a>. <a href="Compensatory%20seat">Compensatory seat</a>s are calculated based on the national vote and are allocated using the <a href="Sainte-Lagu%C3%AB%20method">Sainte-Laguë method</a>, initially at the <a href="Provinces%20of%20Denmark">provincial</a> level and finally at the constituency level. Only parties that reach any one of three thresholds stipulated by section 77 of the Folketing (Parliamentary) Elections Act - winning at least one constituency seat; obtaining at least the <a href="Hare%20quota">Hare quota</a> (valid votes in province/number of constituency seats in province) in two of the three provinces; or obtaining at least 2% of the national vote - compete for compensatory seats.
Election results.
Detailed.
2019.
Results of the <a href="2019%20Danish%20general%20election">2019 general election</a> held on 5 June 2019:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Morten%20B%C3%B8dskov">Morten Bødskov</a> (A), 16,848 votes; <a href="Jeppe%20Bruus">Jeppe Bruus</a> (A), 9,371 votes; <a href="Karen%20Ellemann">Karen Ellemann</a> (V), 23,226 votes; <a href="Mads%20Fuglede">Mads Fuglede</a> (V), 10,020 votes; <a href="Rasmus%20Jarlov">Rasmus Jarlov</a> (C), 19,694 votes; <a href="Kasper%20Sand%20Kj%C3%A6r">Kasper Sand Kjær</a> (A), 6,749 votes; <a href="Pia%20Kj%C3%A6rsgaard">Pia Kjærsgaard</a> (O), 9,953 votes; <a href="Stinus%20Lindgreen">Stinus Lindgreen</a> (B), 1,746 votes; <a href="Sofie%20Carsten%20Nielsen">Sofie Carsten Nielsen</a> (B), 8,955 votes; <a href="Sikandar%20Siddique">Sikandar Siddique</a> (Å), 2,154 votes; <a href="S%C3%B8ren%20S%C3%B8ndergaard%20%28politician%29">Søren Søndergaard</a> (Ø), 4,701 votes; <a href="Ina%20Str%C3%B8jer-Schmidt">Ina Strøjer-Schmidt</a> (F), 4,512 votes; <a href="Mattias%20Tesfaye">Mattias Tesfaye</a> (A), 30,621 votes; and <a href="Kim%20Valentin">Kim Valentin</a> (V), 9,649 votes.
2015.
Results of the <a href="2015%20Danish%20general%20election">2015 general election</a> held on 18 June 2015:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Kenneth%20Kristensen%20Berth">Kenneth Kristensen Berth</a> (O), 2,542 votes; <a href="Morten%20B%C3%B8dskov">Morten Bødskov</a> (A), 10,496 votes; <a href="Mikkel%20Dencker">Mikkel Dencker</a> (O), 2,893 votes; <a href="Karen%20Ellemann">Karen Ellemann</a> (V), 17,276 votes; <a href="Mette%20Frederiksen">Mette Frederiksen</a> (A), 42,676 votes; <a href="Rasmus%20Jarlov">Rasmus Jarlov</a> (C), 6,362 votes; <a href="Pia%20Kj%C3%A6rsgaard">Pia Kjærsgaard</a> (O), 50,397 votes; <a href="Morten%20L%C3%B8kkegaard">Morten Løkkegaard</a> (V), 11,409 votes; <a href="Mogens%20Lykketoft">Mogens Lykketoft</a> (A), 12,106 votes; <a href="Holger%20K.%20Nielsen">Holger K. Nielsen</a> (F), 3,723 votes; <a href="Sofie%20Carsten%20Nielsen">Sofie Carsten Nielsen</a> (B), 10,163 votes; <a href="Joachim%20B.%20Olsen">Joachim B. Olsen</a> (I), 13,120 votes; <a href="Ulla%20Sandb%C3%A6k">Ulla Sandbæk</a> (Å), 4,278 votes; <a href="S%C3%B8ren%20S%C3%B8ndergaard%20%28politician%29">Søren Søndergaard</a> (Ø), 5,632 votes; and <a href="Mattias%20Tesfaye">Mattias Tesfaye</a> (A), 14,957 votes.
2011.
Results of the <a href="2011%20Danish%20general%20election">2011 general election</a> held on 15 September 2011:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Frank%20Aaen">Frank Aaen</a> (Ø), 6,520 votes; <a href="Sophie%20H%C3%A6storp%20Andersen">Sophie Hæstorp Andersen</a> (A), 5,977 votes; <a href="Gitte%20Lillelund%20Bech">Gitte Lillelund Bech</a> (V), 20,978 votes; <a href="Morten%20B%C3%B8dskov">Morten Bødskov</a> (A), 10,307 votes; <a href="Mikkel%20Dencker">Mikkel Dencker</a> (O), 5,780 votes; <a href="Karen%20Ellemann">Karen Ellemann</a> (V), 25,350 votes; <a href="S%C3%B8ren%20Espersen">Søren Espersen</a> (O), 20,053 votes; <a href="Nadeem%20Farooq">Nadeem Farooq</a> (B), 8,668 votes; <a href="Mette%20Frederiksen">Mette Frederiksen</a> (A), 36,783 votes; <a href="Benedikte%20Ki%C3%A6r">Benedikte Kiær</a> (C), 10,641 votes; <a href="Mogens%20Lykketoft">Mogens Lykketoft</a> (A), 16,208 votes; <a href="Holger%20K.%20Nielsen">Holger K. Nielsen</a> (F), 5,950 votes; <a href="Sofie%20Carsten%20Nielsen">Sofie Carsten Nielsen</a> (B), 10,199 votes; <a href="Joachim%20B.%20Olsen">Joachim B. Olsen</a> (I), 7,767 votes; and <a href="Eyvind%20Vesselbo">Eyvind Vesselbo</a> (V), 7,048 votes.
2007.
Results of the <a href="2007%20Danish%20general%20election">2007 general election</a> held on 13 November 2007:
Votes per municipality:
The following candidates were elected:
<a href="Frank%20Aaen">Frank Aaen</a> (Ø), 3,176 votes; <a href="Hanne%20Agersnap">Hanne Agersnap</a> (F), 4,398 votes; <a href="Sophie%20H%C3%A6storp%20Andersen">Sophie Hæstorp Andersen</a> (A), 6,349 votes; <a href="Gitte%20Lillelund%20Bech">Gitte Lillelund Bech</a> (V), 4,088 votes; <a href="Morten%20B%C3%B8dskov">Morten Bødskov</a> (A), 8,918 votes; <a href="Mikkel%20Dencker">Mikkel Dencker</a> (O), 6,544 votes; <a href="Charlotte%20Dyremose">Charlotte Dyremose</a> (C), 3,240 votes; <a href="Karen%20Ellemann">Karen Ellemann</a> (V), 13,513 votes; <a href="S%C3%B8ren%20Espersen">Søren Espersen</a> (O), 21,465 votes; <a href="Mette%20Frederiksen">Mette Frederiksen</a> (A), 47,834 votes; <a href="Bertel%20Haarder">Bertel Haarder</a> (V), 32,354 votes; <a href="Connie%20Hedegaard">Connie Hedegaard</a> (C), 33,328 votes; <a href="Mogens%20Lykketoft">Mogens Lykketoft</a> (A), 14,087 votes; <a href="Holger%20K.%20Nielsen">Holger K. Nielsen</a> (F), 10,432 votes; and <a href="Morten%20Helveg%20Petersen">Morten Helveg Petersen</a> (B), 7,732 votes.
